destination.label: St. Denis
destination.title: La Réunion, the majestic island of the Indian Ocean

content.intro:
In the Mascarene archipelago, Réunion Island, previously called “Bourbon Island”, covers 2,500 sqm and is one of the most fascinating of all the French overseas departments and territories.

Réunion, nicknamed the "intense island", is not a tropical island like any other because it offers travellers a composite of all that is best in the world. With over 40% of the island a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it is one of the few destinations where one can experience so many sensations in a single trip.

Réunion abounds with fabulous coral reefs brimming with myriad colourful species. It is a paradise for snorkelers and diving aficionados. And there are other water sports aplenty, from surfing and canyoning to water skiing and deep-sea fishing.

The distance between land and sea is but a step, so it is easy to discover the island's rich natural resources, its spectacular natural features, and tropical gardens abundant with extraordinary indigenous flora and fauna. Réunion has many treasures including three natural cirques shaped by the erosion of the Piton des Neiges, the highest peak in the Indian Ocean: the Cilaos mineral cirque, Mafate with its exhilarating wilderness and Salazie with its profusion of lush green. It is a timeless setting. Nature lovers are spellbound by the island's grandiose views, the many forest walks bursting with blooms, treks around the immensity of the cirque ramparts and the island's magnificent waterfalls.

For an even greater thrill, take a helicopter flight over the island and discover its endless contrasts. The panoramic views of the landscape at the heart of the Piton de la Fournaise, one of the most active volcanoes in the world, are stupendous. During your rapid ascent, you will also get to see the exceptional, lunar desert-like terrain of the Sand Plains, and the Pas de Bellecombe mountain pass, before reaching the crater: a stunning sight in itself, and undoubtedly an unforgettable moment.

The island boasts architectural heritage, a journey through time amongst the legendary Réunion monuments tracing the origins of Creole culture. And awaken your senses with the exoticism of the island's cuisine, a colourful mix and blend of influences.

An exhilarating adventure awaits you in this open-air paradise. With its infinite charm, exotic sweetness, warm atmosphere, and lush nature, you will be carried away by the magic of this unique island, which never ceases to amaze.

content.title: Le Flagrant Délice, surroundings that dreams are made of

introduction.small: Authentic original cuisine in the heart of the city of Saint-Pierre.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Le Flagrant Délice, surroundings that dreams are made of

paragraphs.text:
The Flagrant Délice is a haven of peace and romance nestled in a garden lush with trees. With a sublime terrace by a sparkling pool, this beautiful Creole house offers its guests a moment of serenity and relaxation in a wondrous architectural setting. Once you are comfortably installed on the terrace, which is decorated in an ethno-chic style, the restaurant offers a traditional and original French menu that is regularly updated to delight the taste buds. This grand table proposes fresh and exotic products: lamb samosas in apricot sauce, toothfish with heritage vegetables, or succulent lamb shanks. There are “Kréole” starters, too - and if it is cheese you are after, order the “Au Bon Fromage par Yann Beaufils” cheeseboard.

The surroundings, atmosphere, and wonderful hospitality make this restaurant an extremely popular spot, so it is advisable to book in advance.

Le Flagrant Delice
115, rue François Mahy
97410 Saint-Pierre

+262 (0) 692 872 803

https://www.facebook.com/leflagrantdelice.fr/?ref=page_internal

Menu : around 50 EUR

content.title: Downtown, good food and party vibes

introduction.small: One of Saint-Pierre's newest hotspots, Downtown has become a go-to for the town's younger generation, and a hit with those looking for a casual, friendly feel.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Downtown, good food and party vibes

paragraphs.text:
Often referred to as the capital of southern Réunion, Saint-Pierre has a fun party hotspot all its own. It embraces the famous Senegalese concept of ‘Teranga', which Jean-Louis Sarr - the brain behind the unique locale - brought with him from his homeland. Teranga is a Wolof word that loosely translates as “hospitality”, although it also embodies the values of sharing and camaraderie you will find at Downtown café, which is located just a few metres from the harbour. It is a popular haunt for locals and tourists alike for having fun with friends, meeting new people, and enjoying the coolness of the place.

As you chat, treat yourself to a poke bowl or plate of seared tuna with locally-sourced ‘péï' vanilla butter – a type of vanilla produced here in Réunion with an incomparable flavour. If your appetite is more on the giant side, go for the 250g Black Angus ribeye, or one of the menu's many burgers - choose from Gorgonzola, chicken, or the vegetarian option of a kidney bean, lentil and chickpea patty. All the vegetables used are grown locally, and the bread and cheese are homemade, with vegan options also available.

As the sun sets, the plant-filled patio and New York-inspired main hall really come to life as the DJ gets to work. Depending on the evening you visit, you might hear soul, hip hop, or even underground music: that is the magic of Downtown!

Downtown
4 rue des Bons Enfants
97410 Saint-Pierre

+262 (0)2 62 08 76 53 / +262 (0)6 93 77 05 74

downtowncafe.re

Menu: around 23 EUR (cocktails from 8 EUR)

content.title: Le Manta, romantic atmosphere in a tropical garden

introduction.small: A mix of Creole and metropolitan influences, Le Manta draws you in with its intimate atmosphere surrounded by Réunion flora, right on La Passe beach.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Le Manta, romantic atmosphere in a tropical garden

paragraphs.text:
Close to Hermitage beach, a lush tropical garden hides Le Manta, a restaurant that is an absolute must on the west coast of Réunion. Once past the large exotic plants lining the entrance, you will discover a 110-sqm varangue, a sort of vast veranda typical in Réunion, which welcomes you into a romantic atmosphere. Under a vetiver roof with a charming natural wood decoration, all lit by a subdued light, your sense of smell is sent into overdrive by the aroma of the dishes. The menu combines Réunion and metropolitan specialities, from tripes à la mode de Caen to spicy Creole puddings and tartiflette with curried zourite, a small octopus found in much of the island's cuisine. The same two influences can be found in a number of fusion dishes, such as duck breast with pineapple or grouper fish blanquette. Enjoy these (in moderation, of course!) with one of the vast selection of house rums available!

Le Manta
18 boulevard Leconte de Lisle
Hermitage
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 33 82 44

www.le-manta.re

Menu: around 30 EUR

content.title: La Cascade Blanche, Creole restaurant surrounded by nature

introduction.small: At the entrance of the cirque de Salazie, La Cascade Blanche restaurant satisfies hikers with its family cooking over a wood fire.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: La Cascade Blanche, Creole restaurant surrounded by nature

paragraphs.text:
The only road to access the cirque de Salazie and its many waterfalls, departmental road (RD) 48 is a must for all mountain aficionados. After the Escalier bridge which spans the Mât river, leave your car to visit the "cascade blanche", a 600m-high waterfall, which is very popular with canyoning enthusiasts. The hiking trail starts just behind the eponymous restaurant, a charming kiosk in the middle of nature. The establishment is flooded with the scent of Creole cuisine, where families and hikers gather at any time of the day. On the menu, you will find traditional dishes with a local twist using regional and seasonal products grown by local farmers. Taste the curried lobster tail, grilled fish with vanilla sauce and crispy gratin or the famous duck breast with honey, cooked over a wood fire. You can also order dishes to take away and enjoy them sitting on the grass, picnic-style with a superb view of the river below.

La Cascade Blanche
RD 48
3 place de l'Escalier
97433 Salazie

+262 (0)2 62 58 39 97

www.facebook.com/Lacascadeblanche97433/

Menu: around 32 EUR

content.title: Sauvage, with your feet in the sand

introduction.small: As it is home to the restaurant Sauvage, Les Brisants beach in Saint-Gilles, Réunion, has become a must-see.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Sauvage, with your feet in the sand

paragraphs.text:
The spot is now an absolute must, to appreciate the sunset on the horizon while enjoying the festive atmosphere of Sauvage. Nestled in a rondavelle, a building with a circular architecture typical of the public spaces of Réunion, on Les Brisants beach, it is a restaurant, a cocktail bar and a beach club all at once.

In a deckchair, facing the sea, or sitting at a large table with your feet in the sand, share a few tapas and one of the week's creative cocktails at aperitif time (enjoyed in moderation, of course!) before continuing with a duck breast with passion fruit or a risotto with camarons (tropical shrimps) and coconut milk for dinner.

It seems that everyone is on board with the concept of Sauvage, so it is advisable to book ahead! Between concerts, yoga and dance classes, the eclectic program brings the beach to life every day. On Sunday evenings, wiggle your hips on the sand to the rhythm of live concerts or admire the show of the dance groups who have come to set the mood...

Sauvage Plage
Plage des Brisants
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 44 88 73

https://www.sauvage.re

Menu: around 25 EUR (tapas from 6 EUR)

content.title: Ness by D-Ocean, a room with a lagoon view

introduction.small: This luxurious complex faces the beach of La Saline-les-Bains, on the west coast of Réunion, and encourages long stays to recharge your batteries.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Ness by D-Ocean, a room with a lagoon view

paragraphs.text:
La Saline lagoon, the natural beach of Trou d'Eau, coconut palms everywhere you look... In the middle of this paradisiacal landscape, Ness by D-Ocean perpetuates the dream. To the south of Saint-Gilles, where lively nightlife blends with the authentic charm of the markets and open-air theatre, this four-star complex invites you to stay for a long time... The rooms, with mountain or ocean views, are at least 36 sqm and are all equipped with a kitchenette. Between the small nautical base – where you can practice kayaking paddle boarding –- and the routes that leave the hotel for the cirque of Mafate and the Piton de la Fournaise, the athletes and budding adventurers among you will have no more than a minute to themselves. As for those who prefer a slower pace, you can laze on the beach or near the immense infinity pool, when you are not enjoying the spa and a Cinq Mondes massage, in the very heart of the residence, of course…

Ness by D-Ocean
26 route du Trou d'Eau
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 70 30 00

www.nessbydocean.com/en

Rooms: from 120 EUR

content.title: Dina Morgabine, a tribute to Réunion

introduction.small: On the west coast of the island, the Dina Morgabine Hotel overlooks the Hermitage beach, popular with tourists for its sheer beauty.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Dina Morgabine, a tribute to Réunion

paragraphs.text:
On the heights of La Saline-les-Bains, the Dina Morgabine Hotel is ideally located, only five minutes away from the spectacular turquoise waters of the lagoon. The rooms offer modern and chic decoration, as well as unobstructed panoramic views over the lush tropical forest, the vast ocean and the Hermitage beach, one of the most beautiful on Réunion. Some are practically self-contained apartments that can sleep up to four people, complete with fully-equipped kitchens and access to a terrace or private veranda. With a steam room, spa and 200 sqm heated swimming pool - especially enjoyable during the Southern Hemisphere winters - the hotel pays tribute to the Réunion island historic sense of welcoming (Dina Morgabine was the island's first name, given by Arab explorers during the 16th century). Traditional elements find their way in the architecture and the pink flamingo, one of Réunion's emblems, can be found in every nook and cranny, all the way up to the hotel's logo. This symbol of balance and elegance perfectly fits Dina Morgabine, your new relaxing refuge to make the best of your stay.

Dina Morgabine Saint-Gilles
80 bis rue des Engagés
Bruniquel
97434 La Saline-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 61 88 88

www.dinamorgabine.com/en/

Rooms: from 89 EUR

content.title: Kaz Insolite, una inmersión en plena naturaleza

introduction.small: Dormir viendo las estrellas, protegido en el interior de una burbuja transparente... eso es exactamente lo que le ofrece este establecimiento de la isla de la Reunión.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Kaz Insolite, una inmersión en plena naturaleza

paragraphs.text:
En pleno bosque de Cryptomeria, cerca del parque nacional de la Reunión, le aguarda un alojamiento de primera. Ligera, casi efímera, esta burbuja le dará la impresión de poder elevarse en cualquier momento. Suspendida, se eleva sobre una plataforma de pilotes para que pueda contemplar el verde paisaje. Diseño y ecología a partes iguales, Kaz Insolite cuenta, además, con una habitación equipada en la parte transparente, un salón y un baño que se comunica con la burbuja. Cada refugio tiene su propio nombre, típico de la región, como «Tec-Tec», «Endormi», «Tang» o «Papangue». Esta última, semiopaca, tiene una habitación para adultos y otra, más pequeña, con capacidad para dos niños. Ya de noche, sáquele partido al telescopio para observar las constelaciones y deleitarse con el panorama. También dispone de una biblioteca en la que podrá conocer el entorno natural que le rodea.

Kaz Insolite
Route Forestière 11 des Makes
97421 Saint-Louis

Tel.: +262 (0)6 92 61 66 17

www.kazinsolite.re/fr

A partir de 215 EUR

content.title: Kaz Insolite, to be fully immersed in nature

introduction.small: Sleep under the stars, protected in a transparent bubble; such is the offer of this Réunion establishment.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Kaz Insolite, to be fully immersed in nature

paragraphs.text:
In the heart of the Cryptomeria forest, near Réunion National Park, first-class accommodation awaits you. Light and almost ephemeral, this bubble will give you the impression of being able to take off at any moment. It is suspended and raised upon a platform of stilts, allowing you to leisurely gaze upon the green landscape. As stylish as it is environmentally friendly, Kaz Insolite is equipped with an outbuilding with a living room and bathroom connected to the bubble, in addition to a bedroom set up in the transparent part. Each shelter bears a typical name from the region, such as "Tec-Tec", "Endormi", "Tang" or "Papangue". The latter, semi-opaque, offers an adult bedroom as a well as a smaller one, which can accommodate two children. At nightfall, take advantage of a telescope to observe the constellations and prepare to be amazed. A library containing books about the region is also at your disposal, to familiarize yourself with the surrounding nature.

Kaz Insolite
393 Route Forestière des Makes
97421 Saint-Louis

+262 (0)9 70 15 57 23

www.kazinsolite.re/en-GB/

Rooms: from 194 EUR

content.title: Canyoning in a marvellous place

introduction.small: Volcanic earth on steep terrain, Réunion Island floats peacefully on the Indian Ocean. Discover the canyoning sites that set the heart of the island racing... and will do the same for you.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Canyoning in a marvellous place

paragraphs.text:
Sites with such poetic names like 'Fleur Jaune' (Yellow Flower) and 'Bras Rouge' (Red Arm) are exceptional sites on Réunion Island. If you are passionate about hiking, climbing, mountaineering or swimming in wild ocean waters, come and see the savage beauty of the island. For more than 20 years, Philippe Mothère has shared his love of canyoning with thrill seekers. He guides Reunion Islanders and tourists alike on aquatic, land and air courses, half a day or a whole day, depending on the level of each.

Dressed in a Neoprene suit, you will rappel in the Cirque de Cilaos waterfall and slide on volcanic rock slides in a series of perfectly carved basins. You walk between the reddish flows of a prodigious landscape, jump into the void with delicious apprehension, and walk along bridges dozens of metres above the ground.

Canyoning La Réunion
2C rue des Hortensias
97413 Cilaos

+262 (0)6 92 85 36 23

https://www.canyoning-la-reunion.fr

content.title: The multi-coloured Kali Kampal temple

introduction.small: Come and celebrate the Hindu goddess Kali in this vibrant Tamil temple.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The multi-coloured Kali Kampal temple

paragraphs.text:
Located in the heart of Saint-Denis, the most important Hindu temple in the region will brighten your day with its bright hues. The various carved scenes of this multi-coloured edifice pay homage to the goddess Kali and give life to this imposing work. You will be able to admire the sacred mountain home to the Hindu gods Parvati, Shiva or Ganesh, among many others.
Built in 1917 by the local merchant community, it was originally a modest-sized iron monument. It has been expanded over the years up until its most recent renovation in 2012 to become the temple you can now admire, which can be visited with the guardian as a guide. Please do not forget to respectfully abide by a few rules such as removing your shoes before going in, and refraining from taking pictures inside. At the end of the tour, you can leave a fruit offering in honour of the goddess Kali.

Kali Kampal Temple
97400 Saint-Denis

https://en.reunion.fr/offers/temple-kali-kampal-saint-denis-en-586342/

content.title: Les Aigrettes, the happiness of the veranda

introduction.small: In the heart of a landscaped park on the west coast of Réunion Island, this small hotel with a pool combines charm and attractive prices.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Les Aigrettes, the happiness of the veranda

paragraphs.text:
Low prices and comfort without compromise are the charm of this family hotel, which offers 75 rooms in a beautiful landscaped area. Decorated with sobriety and taste, this Réunion establishment features spacious 30-sqm double rooms. Some of these are even specifically designed for families, with a capacity of four people.

The designers also introduce you to a beautiful Creole architectural tradition: the veranda. This refers to the area surrounding the buildings and which, here, extends out from every room. Views are guaranteed, whether it is of the whimsical waves or the reliefs of the heart of the island. The beaches and beautiful lagoon of Saint-Gilles-les-Bains are within walking distance but those in a hurry can cool off by diving straight into the hotel pool.

Les Aigrettes
30 chemin Bottard
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 61 84 01

https://www.hotel-lesaigrettes.com

Rooms: from 65 EUR

content.title: Lé Gadiamb, chutney paradise

introduction.small: Vivid, spicy, tasty and strangely named: the food at Lé Gadiamb serves creole cuisine in a traditional setting.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Lé Gadiamb, chutney paradise

paragraphs.text:
"Mmmmmh, it's delicious": this could be the translation of Lé Gadiamb.

Located in the heart of Saint-Denis, near the Petit Marché, Lé Gadiamb is one of the best traditional food establishments in the Réunion capital, so it is highly recommended to book in advance, especially for dinner. Cari, zantak, pat'cochon, duck with vanilla, lontan vegetables, tangors, guava and much more… all the local flavours and traditional preparations are honoured. The snook rougail (hot chutney with smoked fish similar to cod) is especially delicious. The owner and his team are happy to answer questions about the menu, the origin of the recipes and the history of Lé Gadiamb. The setting is charming with its architecture and its decoration in the manner of a Reunionese hut, notably thanks to its guétali, a traditional Creole kiosk with an elevated terrace perfect for an aperitif.

Lé Gadiamb
104 rue Roland-Garros
97400 Saint-Denis

+262 (0)2 62 20 10 79

https://www.facebook.com/legadiamb974

Menu: around 23 EUR

content.title: Le Show Room, party on the waterfront

introduction.small: Ideally situated on the Saint-Pierre seafront facing the harbour, the Show Room is the island's 'must' nightclub for unforgettably warm and lively evenings.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Le Show Room, party on the waterfront

paragraphs.text:
This waterfront disco offers panoramic views from the first-floor terrace onto the boats, the lighthouse and the beach. The decor is reminiscent of the atmosphere of a dark and dim cave with comfortable benches that seem to be carved in stone, giving it a feeling of friendliness and modernity.

The DJ booth and bar pulse with colourful neon lights. Above the walls, illuminated panels broadcast your personalised messages throughout the night. With a young, hip crowd, this club is perfect for an intimate cocktail with a sea view or wild dancing till dawn to the sounds of the hottest DJs.

Show Room also organises a variety of events each month (available online) as well as birthday parties.

Show Room
36 boulevard Hubert Delisle
97410 Saint-Pierre

+262 (0)692 97 05 55

www.showroom.re/?lang=en

content.title: Le Balcon, the place for evening drinks

introduction.small: Standing out with its wrought-iron balcony, this bar and restaurant in Saint-Gilles-les-Bains is the perfect place to meet for a local, festive evening.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Le Balcon, the place for evening drinks

paragraphs.text:
Located in the heart of Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, Le Balcon bar and restaurant is a must for Réunion nights, and is even open on Sundays.

It is renowned for its festive and trendy parties organised throughout the year. Here you can stop by to enjoy a cocktail on the iconic wrought iron balconies accompanied by tasty tapas, specially prepared by the chef. You can also visit for dinner, with suggestions that fuse Creole and metropolitan cuisine, such as the Duck parmentier with apples two ways, hazelnuts and cinnamon, or the Swordfish aumônière parcel with asparagus cream. The casual chic clientele meet for a moment of conviviality and sharing.

From Wednesday to Saturday, the bar plays host to a DJ, and over the course of the evening, turns into a party where many theme evenings are offered. A hedonist haunt par excellence, Le Balcon will seduce you with its unique atmosphere.

Le Balcon
122 avenue Général de Gaulle
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 25 15 81

https://www.facebook.com/LeBalcon974/

Menu: around 25 EUR

content.title: Dance the night away at La Villa Club

introduction.small: One of the largest nightclubs in Saint-Gilles-les-Bains and close to the casino, this is an absolute must on the Réunion nightlife scene.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Dance the night away at La Villa Club

paragraphs.text:
The La Villa Club welcomes its guests in a festive and elegant atmosphere in Saint-Gilles-les-Bains. With three bars and its huge dance floor decorated with a giant disco ball, the place resounds with the sound of its resident DJs who play current hits until sunrise.

Take the opportunity to order a delicious, fresh fruit rum cocktail (to be enjoyed in moderation, of course!) in one of three bars, two of which are on the large outdoor terrace. While you wait for your order, revel in the spectacle offered by the mixologists who concoct your drink with conjuring tricks. With its many theme nights held throughout the year, the La Villa Club has become 'the' place for many resident Réunion night revellers.

Due to its popularity, getting in can sometimes be difficult. Our top tip for getting in the door? Come dressed to impress.

La Villa Club
71 avenue de Bourbon
97434 L'Ermitage-les-Bains

https://www.facebook.com/villaclub974/?rf=414735155228443

+262 (0)6 92 60 19 00

https://www.facebook.com/villaclub974/?rf=414735155228443

content.title: Hotel Le Récif, the Creole villa for budding explorers

introduction.small: Facing the Hermitage lagoon, close to the centre of Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, Le Récif hotel, with its Creole style, is ideal for families with an adventurous spirit.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hotel Le Récif, the Creole villa for budding explorers

paragraphs.text:
A heavenly sanctuary, Le Récif Hotel welcomes you in the heart of a three-hectare tropical garden facing the sea-front.

Its 146 rooms are all tastefully decorated in a colourful, typically Creole style, located under coconut trees, just steps from the sparkling beaches. This typical regional style characterised by wooden panelling and classical furniture is widely renowned.

The hotel also specialises in welcoming families, with 14 specific suites, composed of adjoining rooms that can accommodate even the largest tribes. Set off together to explore the turquoise waters of the Hermitage lagoon, just opposite the hotel, with flippers, masks and snorkels provided by the staff, or the Réunion coastline on a mountain bike ride. From time to time, children can go to the Kids Club Play for creative workshops, while adults enjoy a cocktail of fresh fruit and local rum – to be enjoyed in moderation, of course.

Le Récif
50 avenue de Bourbon
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 70 01 00

https://www.hotellerecif.com/en

Rooms: from 130 EUR

content.title: La Bonne Marmite

introduction.small: Specialising in traditional Creole cuisine, La Bonne Marmite unveils a host of recipes for Réunion-style curries prepared in large pots on a wood fire.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: La Bonne Marmite

paragraphs.text:
Located near Trou d'Eau beach, at the southern exit of La Saline, this popular island restaurant offers Réunion wood-fired cuisine.

Here you will find the best Creole curry, the local speciality made with turmeric, thyme and ginger, served in buffet style to suite all tastes. La Bonne Marmite offers a multitude of variations such as chicken curry, bichiques curry (tiny fried fish), curried prawns… all different and original, and cooked in the traditional way over the fire oven in large pots! This excellent buffet will delight your taste buds with its authentic and delicious recipes.

The quality is undeniable and you are certain to receive a warm to this restaurant set in a pleasant tropical atmosphere bathed in the sound of the gentle surf of the lagoon that is typical to the island.

La Bonne Marmite
68 ter route du Trou d'Eau
97434 La Saline-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 45 46 92

https://www.facebook.com/La-Bonne-Marmite

Menu: around 22 EUR

content.title: Iloha Seaview Hotel, at the heart of Réunion nature

introduction.small: In a room or a bungalow, with your feet practically in the water on the west coast of Réunion Island, you will be surrounded by Creole charm, between nature and well-being.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Iloha Seaview Hotel, at the heart of Réunion nature

paragraphs.text:
Set in the heart of a profusion of nature, facing the bay of Saint-Leu and overlooking the Indian Ocean only a few metres away, the Iloha Seaview Hotel is an intimate address of secret charms.

Its 80 rooms and bungalows, which are spread over a tropical park of three hectares, offer a unique and authentic experience. The simple, elegant hotel is friendly with clean interiors in natural materials. Following an eco-responsible approach that respects the preservation of the ecosystem, the hotel was even awarded the European Ecolabel in 2015. It is an essential starting point for discovering all there is to see on Réunion.

There are two restaurants showcasing the mestizo flavours of the island, including the Kotémer, which offers inventive Creole cuisine. Two pools, a wellness area and a gift shop are also available.

Iloha Seaview Hotel
44 rue Georges Pompidou
Pointe des Châteaux
97436 Saint-Leu

+262 (0)2 62 34 89 89

https://www.iloha.fr/en/

Rooms: from 145 EUR

content.title: L'Atelier de Ben, blended French gastronomy

introduction.small: An elegant place in the Réunion capital where epicureans relish the harmony of world cuisines and flavours.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: L'Atelier de Ben, blended French gastronomy

paragraphs.text:
Having adopted Réunion as his home, Benoît Vantaux opened his kitchen atelier in Saint-Denis in 2006 after presiding over the InterContinental's restaurant in Paris' Place de l'Opéra. Here, you will be served the inventive and creative cuisine of dreams, with space for up to 24 patrons for both lunch and dinner.

Everything is revisited and the menu is constantly being updated. With unpretentious decor in a beautiful black and white space, this restaurant is charming and modern. The service and warm welcome complement a menu full of flavour and authenticity. The chef takes on the great gastronomic classics with an astute marriage of ingredients and offers: to start, salmon Gravlax with lemongrass, thyme, chorizo and sesame, followed by a fillet of beef and foie gras cromesquis. And for dessert, amber rum baba or an almond and raspberry millefeuille.

Benoît also offers cooking classes. Whether you are interested in a workshop or dinner, consider booking ahead!

L'Atelier de Ben
10 rue de la Compagnie
97400 Saint-Denis

+262 (0)2 62 41 85 73

https://latelierdeben.com

Menu: around 33 EUR

content.title: Ô Bar, an essential stop on Réunion's nightlife scene

introduction.small: Warm and casual, Ô Bar is renowned as Saint-Denis' nocturnal haunt, perfect for an aperitif during the week or wild nights at the weekend.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Ô Bar, an essential stop on Réunion's nightlife scene

paragraphs.text:
With its welcoming and festive atmosphere, Ô Bar has become the meeting place for regulars of the Réunion nightlife scene. This famous restaurant-bar-club in Saint-Denis city centre used to be a decoration shop, but now it features minimalist and uncluttered decor.

The restaurant at Ô Bar is open all day, and a brasserie service is also available, offering lunches on the go, all listed on a slate. Cool off in the afternoon with cocktails and other beverages. In the early evening, an aperitif and tapas are offered to guests before dinner.

Its soft light and lounge music make this an ethereal, charming place. At the weekend, Ô Bar turns into a nightclub where DJs transport you back to the 1980s, or another era, depending on the theme of the night. It also has a sheltered outdoor terrace an ideal opportunity to enjoy a local cocktail, in moderation, of course!

Ô Bar
34 rue de la Compagnie
97400 Saint-Denis

+262 (0)2 62 52 57 88 / +262 (0)6 93 90 21 10

https://commande.obar.re

Menu: around 26 EUR

content.title: The Mascarin National Botanical Conservatory

introduction.small: Nestled in an old farm in Saint-Leu, the main mission of this conservatory is to protect and safeguard Reunion's plant species.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Mascarin National Botanical Conservatory

paragraphs.text:
Located in the western hills of Réunion, in the municipality of Saint-Leu and in the heart of an old farm built at the end of the 16th century, the Mascarin National Botanical Conservatory is the result of joint mobilisation of scientists and elected officials, passionate about the island and its remarkable heritage.

Take a stroll to admire the richness and diversity of Réunion flora and you can observe many native species such as coffee, tropical fruits, cacti, orchids and ferns. Access is given to nine hectares of gardens arranged into seven collections you can discover during a family outing through Réunion's vegetal heritage, between flora and history.

The conservatory also offers permanent and temporary exhibitions dedicated to different botanical collections. Guided visits, educational activities, refreshments and a gift shop are also to be found.

Conservatoire botanique national de Mascarin
2 rue du Père Georges
97436 Saint-Leu

+262 (0)2 62 24 27 25

https://www.cbnm.org

content.title: The extraordinary Plaine des Sables

introduction.small: A panorama in varied shades in the heights of Réunion Island, a vast lonely lunar landscape.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The extraordinary Plaine des Sables

paragraphs.text:
Situated at over 2,260m altitude, the Plaine des Sables, which was created from the eruption of Piton Chisny, is on the Plateau des Hauts de l'Île de La Réunion, bounded by sand ramparts and the Bellecombe Pass.

As you head towards the Piton de la Fournaise, your path will lead you to this exceptionally arid, lunar desert plateau. A landscape of dazzling beauty, bordered by mineral nothingness and a palette of reddish and black volcanic slag, it is a unique and arresting spectacle from the first light of day. The ultimate apocalyptic movie set, the first volcanic cones visible on the horizon are the Piton Chisny, the Piton du Cirque and the Piton Rouge. Visitors can venture out on foot in the Plaine des Sables where specially marked trails have been set up for hikers.

Beware, however, as the fog can fall quickly, and it is easy to miss your mark.

https://en.reunion.fr/organize/our-experiences/plaine-des-sables/

content.title: The must-see Saint-Paul market

introduction.small: One of the most popular and typical markets of the island with its diversity of culinary specialities and crafts.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The must-see Saint-Paul market

paragraphs.text:
Located on the waterfront, Saint-Paul's open market is considered the most beautiful and most picturesque on Réunion. It is open all day on Friday and the morning on Saturday.

This is an exotic, colourful market with over 300 stands offering a complete panorama of the local specialities of the island. You will find a section dedicated to local cuisine with a display featuring varieties of spices, Creole dishes such as samosas, and multitudes of seasonal fruits and vegetables. Revive yourself with freshly made juices and drinks, sample snacks or dine in one of the restaurants located within the market or in the immediate vicinity. A visit to the market is a gourmet experience that allows you to enjoy the warm atmosphere of the city while tasting the local Creole specialities.

A second part of the market is dedicated to Réunion crafts where you can find basketry and multi-coloured hats for sale.

Saint-Paul market
Quai Gilbert
97460 Saint-Paul

https://en.reunion.fr/offers/marche-forain-de-saint-paul-saint-paul-en-1160441/

content.title: The exhilarating Piton des Neiges

introduction.small: At over 3,000m, it is considered the highest point in the Indian Ocean.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The exhilarating Piton des Neiges

paragraphs.text:
The Piton des Neiges (Snowy Peak), located north of Cilaos, offers one of Réunion's most beautiful walks. The dormant volcano at its peak, which last erupted centuries ago and is the cause of the area's two tiers, casts a majestic presence at the centre of the island.

The name is misleading, however, as the cap is rarely white and snowfalls are very infrequent. However, the temperature is cool and hikers who plan to make this ascent need to be properly equipped. The ascent takes you through a forest of tamarind and guava, which gives way to slag.

Starting at the Cafre Plain, the Cirque de Salazie or the Cirque de Cilaos, the upward route is spectacular. Once at the top, admire the entire island with the unforgettable Indian Ocean on the horizon merging with the sky. Note that sunrise from this vantage is extraordinary

https://en.reunion.fr/discover/piton-des-neiges-the-heart-and-soul-of-reunion-island/

content.title: The fantastic Piton Maïdo

introduction.small: With breathtaking views at its summit, the Piton Maïdo is a rich and protected nature reserve in Réunion.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The fantastic Piton Maïdo

paragraphs.text:
Located 2,190m above sea level in the heart of the National Park of Réunion, the Piton Maïdo is one of the island's most spectacular spots. It affords a panoramic view over Mafate and the west coast of the island with its golden sand beaches.

Starting from Saint-Paul, it is a beautiful hike for all levels. Many islets that can be seen from here are inhabited, consisting of hamlets and isolated villages, where some people still live independently, almost off the grid, with supplies occasionally brought in by helicopters. Note that Piton Maïdo is accessible by car. This offers an opportunity to admire the Gros Morne, the Grand Bénare, (third highest peak of the island at 2,898m), the Col du Taïbit and the majestic Piton des Neiges.

For mountain bike lovers, it is also possible to bike to the seaside resort of Saint-Gilles. The "Mégavalanche de la Réunion", a famous mountain bike race, is organised here each year.

https://en.reunion.fr/discover/maido-the-balcony-of-reunion-island/

content.title: Relax on the beaches of Saint-Gilles and Boucan Canot

introduction.small: Réunion Island's most emblematic beaches, Saint-Gilles and Boucan Canot, are a must-see for swimming enthusiasts of all levels.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Relax on the beaches of Saint-Gilles and Boucan Canot

paragraphs.text:
Located on the west coast of Réunion, the beaches of Saint-Gilles-les-Bains and Boucan Canot rate among the world's most beautiful shorelines. The vast lagoon, warm white sand and water so clear it looks like a natural swimming pool; its coral reef dotted with a multitude of colours and fish, make Boucan Canot beach the ultimate in tropical paradise.

It also has a special area dedicated to various water sports. We strongly recommend you explore the beauty of the seabed with flippers, mask and snorkel. A short distance away is Saint-Gilles, well known for its sublime and intimate coves and as a destination for scuba diving enthusiasts.

Novices can head to the Tower of Boucan or the sunken barge of Saint-Paul, while professionals will likely prefer the Cap Homard.

content.title: The mythical city of Saint-Denis de La Réunion

introduction.small: The historical and cultural capital of the island, Saint-Denis has a unique heritage and is an ethnic showcase for the Indian Ocean.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The mythical city of Saint-Denis de La Réunion

paragraphs.text:
Located on the north coast, Saint-Denis is the capital of the island and the largest city in all of France's overseas territories.

Formerly a small village of settlers, it experienced an economic rebound during the 18th century when it officially became the capital. Saint-Denis has an extraordinary historical heritage with its museums, parks, monuments and typical Creole houses. Its ethnic and architectural diversity is reflected in its places of worship. You can admire the colourful Tamil gods at the Kali Kampal Temple, visit the Cathedral of Saint-Denis or discover the great Indian-inspired Noor-e-Islam Mosque. Beautiful old mansion-style colonial buildings, meanwhile, mark its old centre. Take in some green with a stroll in the heart of the State Botanical Gardens with its multitude of exotic trees and visit the Natural History Museum.

Continue your promenade on the Barachois, the old port, which has become a pleasant seafront walk, and end your day in the "Cathedral quarter", Saint-Denis' trendiest neighbourhood.

https://en.reunion.fr/organize/activities/a-tour-of-reunion-island/les-etapes-incontournables-en/exploring-saint-denis/

content.title: The Museum of Decorative Arts of the Indian Ocean

introduction.small: With its extensive collection of artworks, this Réunion museum is a certified "Museum of France". The MADOI is located at the heart of an old coffee plantation.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Museum of Decorative Arts of the Indian Ocean

paragraphs.text:
The Museum of Decorative Arts of the Indian Ocean (MADOI) is located in Saint-Louis, on an old estate, the Maison Rouge. The last coffee plantation on the island, it dates back to the 18th century.

The museum deploys its rich collection of furniture, textiles, Chinese porcelain, artworks etc. into a varied programme of temporary exhibitions. You will also find a room dedicated to turtles, identifying three different themes: the legends and mythology surrounding this creature in various civilisations, the use of its scales in history, and the contemporary creation of art with a workshop presenting scaling craftsmanship. The MADOI also organises guided tours focusing on the historical, architectural and agricultural dimensions of the great coffee plantation in the area around the Maison Rouge. Tours on the history of Bourbon coffee (the original name of the island) are also offered.

Check out the MADOI's workshops and events on its website.

Museum of Decorative Arts of the Indian Ocean (MADOI)
17A chemin Maison Rouge
97450 Saint-Louis

+262 (0)2 62 91 24 30

https://museesreunion.fr/madoi/

content.title: Saint-Leu, for sports enthusiasts

introduction.small: A small seaside resort, Saint-Leu is Réunion's surfing capital with its world-famous spots, welcoming all thrill-seekers.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Saint-Leu, for sports enthusiasts

paragraphs.text:
Just 16km south of Saint-Gilles, Saint-Leu is an important seaside fishing village. This is where the legendary wave known as the "Gauche de Saint-Leu" breaks on the beach, rolling in from the north and creating a world-class surfing spot. With its multitude of fish species, it is also the starting point for underwater diving enthusiasts. The surrounding area is also renowned for the many water sports on offer. There are many paragliding clubs located in the town; Réunion's microclimate enables flights almost year-round. Other activities such as sailing, fishing, mountain biking, and hiking are yours for the taking. Forest trails, year-round swimming, white sand beaches and a warm, mild climate with water temperature at 25°C make Saint-Leu a sports-lover's destination spot.

Saint-Leu is a vibrant town that is full of character, with a number of must-see historical and cultural sites to explore during your stay, such as the Notre-Dame-de-La-Salette sanctuary, the scene of an annual pilgrimage, the Mascarin National Botanical Conservatory and Kélonia, a sea turtle observatory.

content.title: Réunion from a bird's eye view

introduction.small: A high-flying escape to a beautiful, awe-inspiring panorama and an unforgettable first flight.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Réunion from a bird's eye view

paragraphs.text:
In the heart of the Indian Ocean, Réunion offers fantastic views.

Its exceptional reliefs, numerous turquoise lagoons, and steep cirques and ramparts make it a rare and unforgettable destination. The Trou de Fer (Iron Hole) Canyon with breathtaking waterfalls, the 3,000m-high Piton des Neiges and the active Piton de la Fournaise volcano all make for a sensational show when seen from the sky.

Taking off from Pierrefonds Airport, Corail Helicopters offers a variety of tours, including a complete island tour with volcano-viewing by night. Helilagon, taking off from l'Éperon (Saint-Paul) offers identical tours as well as heli-hiking and heli-4-wheel drive combo tours.

Corail Helicopters
Departing from Pierrefonds Airport
97410 Saint-Pierre Cedex
+262 (0)2 62 22 22 66
http://www.corail-helicopteres.com/en

Helilagon
Éperon Altiport
190 chemin Summer N° 2
97864 Saint-Paul Cedex
+262 (0)2 62 55 55 55
https://www.helilagon.com

content.title: Réunion National Park

introduction.small: Between cirques, volcanic massifs and primary forests, this earthly paradise is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Réunion National Park

paragraphs.text:
Established in 2007 and covering more than 40% of the surface of the island, the national park is home to subtropical and tropical primary forests, constituting an impressive mosaic of ecosystems and sensational landscapes, such as the Bélouve Forest.

It includes two major volcanic mountains: the extinct Piton des Neiges, rising to over 3,000m, and the Piton de la Fournaise, once of the most active volcanoes on the planet. The spectacular landscape offers a breathtaking viewpoint and crests hundreds of metres high. This exceptional landscape is also dominated by three magnificent cirques: Mafate, Cilaos and Salazie, all three created by landslides.

This paradise is a boon for hikers who come to admire the beauty and richness of Réunion's heritage, as this ensemble creates a unique and spectacular landscape that contributes significantly to biodiversity conservation.

Parc national de La Réunion
258 rue de la République
97431 Plaine des Palmistes

+262 (0)2 62 90 11 35

www.reunion-parcnational.fr

content.title: The Réunion Aquarium, a showcase of the Réunion marine environment

introduction.small: A rewarding and surprising discovery of the sumptuous seabed of the Indian Ocean, with educational spaces specifically dedicated to its youngest visitors.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Réunion Aquarium, a showcase of the Réunion marine environment

paragraphs.text:
Perfect for a family outing, the great aquarium of Réunion is located on an artificial island in the heart of the marina in Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, a seaside resort on the west coast of the island.

Created a few years ago, the aquarium aims to be an information and awareness showcase dedicated to the rich and diverse Réunion marine environment. The Réunion Aquarium also strives to actively contribute to the enhancement of the entire Réunion marine heritage while promoting awareness of reef ecosystems. In a first tank, it offers a fun visit of the fauna of the lagoon, with educational spaces devoted to the biodiversity of the open sea. There is also a second tank, dedicated to drop-offs, where you can discover their marine diversity, between volcanic cliffs and other reef faults. A total of 600,000 litres of seawater is required to fill this giant tank, where you will find nearly 500 species of fish in myriad colours and everything from giant kingfish, sharks, seahorses and lobsters to coral and about 200 species of Réunion reef life.

Allow about one hour for the visit.

L'Aquarium de La Réunion
Port de plaisance
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 33 44 00

www.aquariumdelareunion.com

content.title: The wealth of the city of Saint-Pierre

introduction.small: As a cosmopolitan city with a rich history in Réunion, Saint-Pierre is considered to be both a modern and unusual city.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The wealth of the city of Saint-Pierre

paragraphs.text:
Nicknamed the "southern capital", Saint-Pierre is the third most populous city of Réunion. A vast agricultural and maritime town, it has a large port with a long boulevard along the Indian Ocean and walking it is highly recommended.

Saint-Pierre, a rich and vibrant city, stands out for the diversity of its cultures and ethnic groups. All co-exist in a warm and peaceful atmosphere to the delight of its visitors. A real melting pot, the city has a small fishing port, Tamil and Chinese temples, mosques and churches. In the heart of downtown, you can take the charming Des Bons Enfants shopping street and dwell on the beautiful covered market stalls offering a wide variety of spices and handicrafts. The Saint-Pierre market is open every day except Sunday. Steps away you will find a media library, which is located within the grounds of the old shops of the East India Company.

In the upper town, immerse yourself in the old-world charm of the town's ancient and atypical colonial houses.

https://www.sudreuniontourisme.fr/offices/saint-pierre.html

content.title: The Pointe au Sel blowhole in Saint-Leu

introduction.small: One of Réunion's natural curiosities, this geological phenomenon astounds with the intensity of its bursts of mist coming from the ocean depths.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Pointe au Sel blowhole in Saint-Leu

paragraphs.text:
The Piton des Neiges once an active volcano, belched lava flows across a vast swathe of the island. One of these flows created a cliff that is now the region of Pointe au Sel.

Just outside of Saint-Leu, located on the coast of the town, a very popular natural curiosity awaits: the blowhole. Under the pressure of waves, a strong jet of spray several metres high erupts through a small funnel-shaped collapse in the arch of this underwater cave. The magmatic particularity of the coastline is at the origin of this impressive phenomenon. During strong storms of extreme intensity, it is a place of grandiose natural spectacle. To get there, go south from Saint-Leu and look for a sign directing you to Le Souffleur (The Blowhole) on National Route 1.

You can get there by car: parking has been arranged for visitors and a staircase will allow you to access the site.

https://en.reunion.fr/offers/souffleur-saint-leu-en-586348/

content.title: Villa Angélique, Creole style in an intimate setting

introduction.small: Along the most prestigious artery of Saint-Denis, the Villa Angélique breathes authenticity with its neoclassical wooden architecture.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Villa Angélique, Creole style in an intimate setting

paragraphs.text:
Listed as a historical monument of Réunion, the Villa Angélique displays a typical Creole style.

It is conveniently located in the business district of Saint-Denis, on the rue de Paris (formerly Rue Royale), only eight kilometres from the airport and 20 minutes from the beach. It is in a calm, wooded setting that the Villa Angélique offers its guests seven rooms, including two suites with furniture in the style of the East India Company, all of which feature contemporary comfort - with internet connection reaching into the garden.

This discrete hotel takes you on a magnificent journey through time and offers all modern comforts with the highest-quality bedding. Two meeting rooms complete the ideal amenities for business travellers. With a bistro-style lunch and a more refined and elegant dinner, Villa Angélique will seduce you with its inventive traditional cuisine.

Villa Angélique
39 rue de Paris
97400 Saint-Denis

+262 (0)2 62 48 41 48

www.villa-angelique.fr/hotel-and-restaurant/

Rooms: from 160 EUR

content.title: Ultimate relaxation at Le Saint-Alexis

introduction.small: A haven of peace tucked away in a tropical garden in Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, Le Saint-Alexis calls for relaxation, whether in one of its luxurious rooms or in the heart of the spa.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Ultimate relaxation at Le Saint-Alexis

paragraphs.text:
Wonderfully located opposite one of the most beautiful beaches on the island, Boucan Canot in Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, Le Saint Alexis Hotel is a place of refinement and serenity.

Perfectly situated between light and water, this luxury hotel, named after the ship that transported the first French navigators to India, has 58 rooms decorated with simplicity and elegance, large bathrooms with a whirlpool bath, and a balcony or a private terrace by the pool. Originality, subtlety and friendliness are combined here to guarantee a quiet stay and total calm.

In addition to its gourmet restaurant, a large number of facilities are available including a sauna, steam room, gym and spa that showcase Réunion expertise and modern techniques. With about forty different treatments on offer, take some time for yourself during the ultimate relaxation break.

Le Saint-Alexis Hotel & Spa
44 route de Boucan Canot
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 24 42 04

http://en.hotelsaintalexis.com/

Rooms: from 189 EUR

content.title: Chez Nous, a taste of the Mediterranean in Réunion

introduction.small: A symbol of the metropolitan community in Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, this restaurant and bar is one of the city's most popular trendy hangouts.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Chez Nous, a taste of the Mediterranean in Réunion

paragraphs.text:
Located in the heart of friendly and lively Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, Chez Nous is an iconic restaurant and bar in the city.

Founded in 1994 by four Marseillais nostalgic for their hometown, Chez Nous, attracts a trendy clientele with its modern and contemporary design, Mediterranean inspirations, and warm, festive and relaxed atmosphere.

The menu offers a clever mix of flavours with suggestions such as a scallop and citrus salad, a hot and cold sea bream and avocado dish, bluefin tuna tartare, veal kidneys à la Dijonnaise or a snail parmentier with thyme and garlic cream sauce, all accompanied by an excellent selection of wines. As the evening progresses, the music gets louder. On the bar side, you can push the tables aside to create a dance floor where you can swing and sway the night away to old school tunes. At the weekend, Chez Nous gives way to DJ parties lasting into the night.

Chez Nous
122 rue du Général de Gaulle
97434 Saint-Gilles-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 24 08 08

https://www.facebook.com/ChezNousRestaurant/

Menu: around 30 EUR

content.title: Cirque de Cilaos, a haven of peace

introduction.small: Lovers of walks in the very heart of nature should visit the Cirque de Cilaos, a unique site created by the erosion and collapse of the Piton des Neiges walls.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Cirque de Cilaos, a haven of peace

paragraphs.text:
Cilaos, a pleasant town decorated with flowers, is in the centre of Réunion, in the natural amphitheatre of the same name. Embellished with a pond named Mare Reeds and the starting point for many tours on foot or by car, it is considered an important site for outdoor sports.

Accessible by road from Saint-Louis, the area is famous for its water, which is distributed throughout the island, its lentil cultivation, as well as for its embroidery crafts, which use a famous embroidery technique known as Jours de Cilaos (Cilaos Days). It also boasts a vineyard, the cellar of Cilaos, producing young but very promising wines. Located in the Massif south of Piton des Neiges, the remarkable Cirque de Cilaos is easily discovered via Bras Rouge waterfall trail.

For a breathtaking view, do not miss the Roche Merveilleuse trail: just follow the Bras Sec road, which offers a stunning panorama of the immense Cirque de Cilaos.

https://en.reunion.fr/discover/cirques/cirque-of-cilaos-a-taste-of-freedom/

content.title: Akoya Hotel & Spa, a west coast treasure

introduction.small: Located in the heart of a three-hectare park overlooking the protected lagoon of Trou d'Eau, this hotel is a place of relaxation, privacy and serenity.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Akoya Hotel & Spa, a west coast treasure

paragraphs.text:
This lush sanctuary combines the charm of its Creole heritage with contemporary elegance and modernity. Akoya takes its name from the pearl of the same name, a treasure in Asia, recognised for its purity, colour and the soft pearly perfection of its form.

With special care given to the architecture, the hotel has been designed with minimalist decor combining natural materials, elegant spaces, delicate colours and refined furniture, giving the place a unique and warm atmosphere. Each corner of the hotel is a paradise beginning with the pool and its soft linear curves to the designer bar, and its many palm trees and exotic flowers.

There are also two Creole-inspired restaurants to choose from. One of these is Le Dôme, which opens out onto the poolside terrace and offers an ever-changing menu that subtly blends flavours from around the world into fusion food perfectly embodying the spirit of Réunion.

L'Horizon lounge bar welcomes you with tasty cocktails for you to enjoy in moderation, along with local dishes, while gazing at the splendid view of the blue lagoon.

Akoya Hotel & Spa
6 impasse des Goélands
97434 La Saline-les-Bains

+262 (0)2 62 61 61 62

www.akoya-hotel.com/en/home-2/

content.title: Lounge around on the Blue Margouillat's veranda

introduction.small: A charming and extraordinary oasis of peace.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Lounge around on the Blue Margouillat's veranda

paragraphs.text:
The hotel is located on the west coast of the island under gentle trade winds, facing the majestic Indian Ocean. With 14 rooms including two suites, the Blue Margouillat combines the beauty of colonial villas with the modernity of a contemporary art gallery.

With its convivial charm, the establishment exudes an explosion of scents, between its exotic wood, bright hibiscus and immaculate frangipani trees. Focused on sensory experiences, calm, relaxation, serenity and pleasure, the hotel offers wellness products - bath salts, massage oils, moisturising creams, and more - and a wide range of treatments inspired by natural medicines. If you are in search of a romantic evening, gourmet dinners are served by candlelight in a cosy, jazz-infused atmosphere.

Be sure also to admire the works of art signed by young Réunion talents exhibited throughout the interior of the hotel.

Blue Margouillat
6 impasse Jean Albany

content.title: Boucan Canot Hotel on the water

introduction.small: In Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, this boutique hotel perched on volcanic rock facing the ocean exudes charm and excellence with authentic Creole architecture.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Boucan Canot Hotel on the water

paragraphs.text:
Overlooking a white sandy cove on the west coast of the island and facing the magnificent panorama of the Indian Ocean, the Boucan Canot hotel is a cosy hotel that combines modern charm with Creole architecture.

Its 46 spacious and comfortable rooms with wood panelling and bright fabrics offer an exceptional and unique view of the immensity of the turquoise sea from your balcony. Atop a volcanic rock facing the waves, this unique hotel is an invitation to escape and relax. A dip in salt water is mere steps away - unless you are tempted by the pool below your balcony! Go for the "senior suites" offering Jacuzzis and large terraces.

Guests can dine at the La Table du Boucan gourmet restaurant, offering fine, elegant cuisine combining Réunion specialities and seasonal ingredients.

Hôtel Boucan Canot

content.title: Golf courses

introduction.small: Réunion has three major golf courses, conveniently spread across the island in three different regions.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Golf courses

paragraphs.text:
Blue Basin Golf Course, located in Saint-Gilles-les-Hauts, in the west of the island, is an 18-hole course with one side facing a gorgeous sea view and the other, a forest covered with eucalyptus trees. An energising panorama of blue and green for a course that has notably welcomed the International Open of Réunion in 2006.

Colorado Golf Course, located in La Montagne, is a nine-hole course. As it is 600m up in the hills of Saint-Denis de la Réunion, the view from the golf course to the north of the island is magnificent. This course has a reputation for being rather technical, particularly due to sloping nature.

The Bourbon de l'Étang-Salé Golf Club is located in the south-west of the island, near Saint-Pierre, and extends over 70 hectares. It is the oldest Réunion golf club with holes nestled in the forest. It also has a pool, tennis courts and a restaurant.

content.title: Explore Takamaka Valley

introduction.small: A subtle blend of primordial nature and tropical oasis form the Takamaka Valley, with waterfalls, rivers and rocky peaks as a backdrop.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Explore Takamaka Valley

paragraphs.text:
The Takamaka Valley in eastern Réunion is in the municipality of Saint- Benoît, the second largest municipality after Saint-Paul, and is a veritable earthly paradise. You can get there along the Marsouin River where fabulous hiking awaits the more athletic.

Considered one of the wettest places on earth, the Takamaka Valley has a hydroelectric dam upstream of five waterfalls: Arc-en-Ciel, Surplomb, Petit and Grand Gingembre and Petit Cimetière. Its lush vegetation, extensive rivers, spectacular waterfalls of several hundred metres and towering rocky peaks make this idyllic place a veritable Olympus.

Peaking at over 800m, Takamaka Valley offers a wondrous perspective where you have the opportunity, when skies are clear, of seeing the impressive Piton des Neiges and the incredible Mafate Cirque.

https://en.reunion.fr/offers/takamaka-saint-benoit-en-586374/

content.title: O' QG, a ‘reunion' of cultures

introduction.small: In the heart of Plaine-des-Cafres, O' QG fuses multicultural inspirations, tapping into Creole, metropolitan and West African gastronomy to create a unique cuisine.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: O' QG, a ‘reunion' of cultures

paragraphs.text:
Located in Bourg-Murat at the Plaine-des-Cafres, the restaurant O'QG (French abbreviation for 'headquarters') has established itself as a reference in the culinary, gourmet landscape of Réunion.

This authentic restaurant with a cosy ambience combines local products, both French and African cuisine and puts taste first, all "homemade" on-site. Abdoulaye Sadji, the Senegalese owner, cultivates a mix of genres and cultures, and welcomes you to his traditional wood-fired Creole cuisine restaurant, where friendliness and good humour reign. On the yellow walls, small and large colourful works of art watch over the brown tiled tables.

Here, you will delight in an infinite number of different flavours such as ‘pig's trotter' cari, duck breast, fresh fish and homemade chips, or even warm goat's cheese salad. This is a table for hearty appetites, which fuses different styles to create a world food tour.

O'QG Restaurant
60 bis rue Alfred-Picard
Bourg-Murat
97418 La Plaine-des-Cafres

+262 (0)2 62 25 02 17

https://oqg-restaurant.com/ENGLISH/

Menu: around 42 EUR

content.title: Well-being surrounded by nature at the Palm Hotel & Spa

introduction.small: An exceptional setting nestled in the heart of a lush and unspoiled environment of Réunion Island, the Palm Hotel & Spa is the place to recharge your batteries.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Well-being surrounded by nature at the Palm Hotel & Spa

paragraphs.text:
Located close to the natural sites classified by UNESCO and considered one of the finest hotels on Réunion, the Palm Hotel & Spa is a temple of elegance and refinement. Comfortable and soothing, everything has been designed for the well-being of its guests.

Experience peace and serenity in this privileged space nestled on the cliffside overlooking the turquoise waters of the Indian Ocean. In the heart of a three-hectare tropical garden, 65 rooms, suites and cottages offer all the modern amenities in relaxing and earthy tones. Relax in the sparkling infinity pool or the sublime spa offering oriental massage with traditional techniques.

Three restaurants complete the hotel offer, including the Makassar, gourmet jewel of the hotel, making refined local specialities to arouse and delight your taste buds.

Palm Hotel & Spa
43 rue des Mascarins
Grand Anse
97429 Petite-Île

+262 (0)2 62 56 30 30

https://palm.re/en/

Rooms: from 300 EUR

content.title: The Lodge Roche Tamarin & Spa, surrounded by nature

introduction.small: This piece of paradise is immersed in a green environment in the heart of a tropical area of ​​15,000 sqm.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Lodge Roche Tamarin & Spa, surrounded by nature

paragraphs.text:
Built on a mountainside, the Lodge Roche Tamarin & Spa enjoys a stunning panorama of the Indian Ocean. Walkways connect the 20 suites and lodges built on stilts and completely surrounded by nature. Composed entirely of wooden logs and shimmering coloured stones, the hotel is an invitation to escape into calm and serenity, and to rest the body and soul.

Its lush vegetation, wild fragrances, colourful plants and birdsong transport you into a unique and idyllic atmosphere. The cosy, comfortable cabins are elegantly decorated, each with its own private ocean view terrace. Some even have a whirlpool bath, ideal for relaxing at nightfall under the starry sky. A pleasant and restful stay that will recharge your batteries and fill you with happiness.

Do not hesitate to try Les Baies Roses restaurant or the Body Harmony spa, which offers natural treatments for your body's well-being.

Lodge Roche Tamarin & Spa Nature Village
142 chemin Bœuf Mort
97419 La Possession

+262 (0)2 62 44 66 88

https://www.lodgetamarin.com

Rooms: from 162 EUR

content.title: Piton de la Fournaise, an active volcano

introduction.small: An unforgettable and must-see site of the island, it is one of the most active volcanoes on the planet.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Piton de la Fournaise, an active volcano

paragraphs.text:
Located in the south of the island and rising to over 2,631m, the Piton de la Fournaise is one of the most active volcanoes in the world. Its vast massif occupies about one third of the island.

Since its eruption in 1998, which continued for nearly six months, it has seen several eruptions a year. Access, however, is relatively easy by road from the Plaine des Sables, which leads to Bellecombe Pass, an opportunity to witness projections and frequent lava flows. Once there, a gorgeous view overlooking the Enclos Fouqué and Formica Leo opens up. It is worth noting that each eruption changes the configuration of the area. Though the overall landscape is set in a dominantly mineral state, once the lava eventually cools, a natural process of vegetation is established, giving birth to a very diverse ecosystem of fauna and flora.

The Piton de la Fournaise has been continuously monitored since the establishment of a volcano observatory. In October 2019, the Piton Fréri came into being, a new volcanic cone that appeared after the last eruption.

https://fournaise.info/articles-in-english/

content.title: Lux* Saint Gilles Resort, 5-star Réunion living

introduction.small: In the heart of a tropical garden by Réunion's Hermitage beach, in Saint-Gilles-les-Bains, this sumptuous resort promises a carefree stay.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Lux* Saint Gilles Resort, 5-star Réunion living

paragraphs.text:
A frequent winner at the World Travel Awards in the Réunion Island's Leading Hotel category, Hotel Lux* is located at the Hermitage, in an idyllic and lush setting by the sea. It is a haven of peace surrounded by coconut trees, white sand and an endless turquoise lagoon.

Consisting of 23 villas on an area of seven hectares and 174 rooms including eight suites, the hotel is decorated in a local and colonial style, with slate floors and handmade furniture. Take advantage of the services offered such as swimming pool, golf course, tennis, diving, spa and gym. Start the day with a yoga session in the heart of the tropical gardens and finish it with a private treatment in your room, allowing you to completely switch off.

Come and revel in one of the hotel's four restaurants where you will get to savour iconic, exotic flavours, and enjoy one of the island's best restaurants in the Orangine, an intimate sanctuary of gastronomy.

Lux* Saint Gilles Resort
28 rue du Lagon
L'Hermitage

+262 (0)2 62 70 00 00

https://www.luxresorts.com/en/reunion/hotel/luxsaintgilles

Rooms: from 172 EUR

content.title: Marvel at the Langevin waterfall from below

introduction.small: One of the most memorable and imposing waterfalls of Réunion, offering hiking and wild swimming.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Marvel at the Langevin waterfall from below

paragraphs.text:
Located in the south of Réunion along the Langevin River, which flows from north to south before emptying into the Indian Ocean, the Langevin Waterfall, also called the "Grand Galet", is probably one of the most beautiful and unmissable waterfalls on the island.

The banks of the river Langevin are the perfect spot for a traditional picnic, with the surging crystal-clear water making for a unique and stunning backdrop. For lovers of aquatic landscapes, going down from the Langevin Waterfall, you will come across its sister, the Trou Noir, which is also worth a visit: swimming is refreshing and easily accessible. Directions: at the exit of St. Joseph, continue on the road to the village of "Langevin" and then turn left at the large metal gate. The route then follows the river by a steep, winding road up to the waterfall.

On the way you will find many pineapple, banana and litchi tree plantations.

Langevin Waterfall
43 route de Grand Galet
97480 Saint-Joseph
https://en.reunion.fr/offers/cascade-grand-galet-saint-joseph-en-586377/

content.title: CLIMATE AND WEATHER IN St. Denis
content.introduction: Réunion has a humid tropical climate overall. As a mountainous island, various regions experience a range of vastly different microclimates. For example, the eastern coast records high rainfall and is very exposed to trade winds blowing from east to west. In contrast, the western coast, which is protected by the relief, remains relatively dry. There are also considerable temperature differences: the weather can be quite warm along the ocean and relatively cool in the higher elevations.

airports.title: Réunion Roland Garros Airport
airports.description:
The Réunion Roland Garros Airport is located about 9km (6 miles) west of Saint-Denis.
  • One terminal

Getting from the airport to Saint-Denis and back:
  • By car
    • The N2 road connects the airport to Saint-Denis - the journey takes around 30 minutes.
    • There are two parking facilities available at the airport:
      - One short-stay car park (P1) outside the terminal: the first 15 minutes are free, then it is EUR 1 for 16 to 30 minutes, EUR 2 for 31 to 45 minutes, and EUR 3 for 46 minutes to 1 hour. - One long-stay car park (P4) less than a minute's walk from the Departures hall: costs EUR 33 for the first 24 hours then EUR 6 per day.
    • Several car rental companies have counters at the airport.
  • By bus
    • The T bus routes run between the airport and the main bus station in Saint-Denis every day of the week, with ZO buses operated by Car Jaune serving the same route from Monday to Saturday. The trip takes around 25 minutes and the fare is EUR 5 each way. For more information go to https://www.carjaune.re
  • By shuttle bus
    • A shuttle bus service connects the airport (stop outside the terminal) to the Saint-Denis town hall in about 30 minutes. Buses run daily from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The fare is EUR 4 each way.
  • By taxi
    • Taxis are available at the ranks outside the terminal. The trip to the city centre costs about EUR 25 (EUR 35 at night).
  • Services: shops, bars and restaurants, free Internet access (Wi-Fi) available in the airport.
  • Telephone: +262 (0)2 62 48 81 81
  • Website: https://www.reunion.aeroport.fr/en

transportation.title: GETTING AROUND St. Denis
transportation.description: Getting around Réunion is very easy. The island has an efficient bus network serving all municipalities, including Saint-Denis, Saint-Pierre, Le Tampon, Saint-Benoît, Saint-Leu, Salazie, Saint-Paul and Saint-André. In addition, the island's roads are well maintained and make it possible to reach any point of interest by car or motorcycle.

In order to travel in the best conditions and for your health and safety, we invite you to check all information regarding preventive measures and best practices to be respected, available on the official website of the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs: https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus

Your comfort, well-being and health are at the heart of Air France's concerns, and we want to help you prepare for your trip in the best way possible. Find out more about the measures taken to ensure safe travelling on our website: https://www.airfrance.fr/FR/en/common/page_flottante/information/coronavirus.htm#notre-engagement-sanitaire

See your doctor before you travel. It is also recommended to take out insurance covering medical expenses and repatriation before your trip. Réunion counts several hospitals and medical institutions, as well as quality medical practitioners and health specialists.

localCalendar.title: FESTIVALS, HOLIDAYS AND OTHER ANNUAL EVENTS IN St. Denis
localCalendar.description: There are a number of festivals, holidays and other events celebrated in Réunion each year. The main ones are listed below.

events.title: January or February: Chinese New Year (local event)
events.description: The Chinese New Year is celebrated in Réunion to mark the start of a new lunar year. Dragon parades and lion dances take place amid general merry-making.

events.title: March or April: Easter Monday (national holiday)
May 1: Labour Day (national holiday)
events.description: On the first of May, it is customary to offer a sprig of lily-of-the-valley to close ones. Many vendors occupy the pavement on that occasion!

events.title: May 8: Victory Day (national holiday)
events.description: Commemorates the Allied victory in Europe that ended World War II on this day in 1945. Various ceremonies are held around town.

events.title: June 21: Fête de la Musique (celebrated nationwide)
events.description: Also celebrated internationally as World Music Day, for this festival many free concerts featuring all types of music are held in the streets and at various venues around Réunion, with the revelry continuing late into the night.

events.title: July 14: Bastille Day (national holiday)
events.description: This holiday celebrates both the storming of the Bastille prison in 1789, the key event marking the beginning of the French Revolution. It plays as a symbol of the end of the privileges enjoyed by the clergy and the aristocracy. In Réunion, it is commemorated with a variety of events. Highlights include parades, dances and fireworks, all in a festive atmosphere.

events.title: August 15: Assumption Day (national holiday)
events.description: This celebration, still very popular in Réunion, is marked by several religious ceremonies. The most popular takes place in Piton Sainte-Rose, where the Vierge au parasol (Virgin with the sunshade) stands, in front of Notre-Dames des Laves Church. Miraculously, the volcanic eruption that happened in Piton Sainte-Rose in 1977 left the building untouched.

events.title: Third weekend in September: European Heritage Days (celebrated nationwide)
events.description: The aim of the European Heritage Days is to open up, free of charge, numerous sites and monuments, many of which are normally closed to the public, such as private estates and collections. A perfect occasion for a stroll and the discovery of architectural gems.

events.title: November 11: Remembrance Day (national holiday)
events.description: On this day, French citizens gather at war memorials to commemorate the signing of the 1918 Armistice officially bringing an end to the First World War.

events.title: December 20: Abolition of Slavery Day (local holiday)
events.description: The abolition of slavery in Réunion on this day in 1848 is commemorated each year with a number of official ceremonies, cultural events and much music and dancing.

events.title: December 31: New Year's Eve (national event)
events.description: On the night of December 31<sup>st</sup>, the atmosphere is particularly festive on the streets of Réunion, with families and friends celebrating the new year.

goodToKnow.daylightSavingTime: There is no daylight saving time in Réunion
goodToKnow.tips:
Tipping
In Réunion like elsewhere in France, a service charge is always included in the bill. If you are particularly pleased with the service, you may certainly leave a few extra euros on the table. But this additional tip is neither expected nor necessary.
